intro: Stenanthemum tridentatum, commonly known as the three-toothed stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in heathlands and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive three-lobed shape, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is valued in horticulture for its resilience and ability to attract native pollinators.
